001package com.technototes.library.command;
002
003import androidx.annotation.Nullable;
004
005import java.util.HashMap;
006import java.util.LinkedHashSet;
007import java.util.Map;
008import java.util.Set;
009import java.util.function.BooleanSupplier;
010
011import com.technototes.library.general.Periodic;
012import com.technototes.library.structure.CommandOpMode;
013import com.technototes.library.subsystem.Subsystem;
014
015/**
016 * This is a "singleton" object.
017 * <p>
018 * TODO: The "CommandScheduler.getInstance()" thing is really kinda silly. Perhaps it's how WPIlib
019 * TODO: works, but it's clunky and makes things messier for non-FRC programmers. I think I'm going
020 * TODO: yoink that method and make static methods for next year's release...
021 */
022public final class CommandScheduler {
023
024    private final Map<Command, BooleanSupplier> commandMap;
025    private final Map<Subsystem, Set<Command>> requirementMap;
026    private final Map<Subsystem, Command> defaultMap;
027
028    private final Set<Periodic> registered;
029
030    private CommandOpMode opMode;
031
032    public CommandScheduler setOpMode(CommandOpMode c) {
033        opMode = c;
034        return this;
035    }
036
037    public CommandScheduler terminateOpMode() {
038        opMode.terminate();
039        return this;
040    }
041
042    public double getOpModeRuntime() {
043        return opMode.getOpModeRuntime();
044    }
045
046    // The Singleton CommandScheduler
047    private static CommandScheduler instance;
048
049    /**
050     * Get (or create) the singleton CommandScheduler object
051     *
052     * @return The CommandScheduler singleton
053     */
054    public static synchronized CommandScheduler getInstance() {
055        if (instance == null) {
056            instance = new CommandScheduler();
057        }
058        return instance;
059    }
060
061    /**
062     * Alex had a comment "be careful with this" and he's not wrong.
063     * This removes the old Singleton and creates a new one. That's pretty dangerous...
064     *
065     * @return a *new* singleton object (which makes very little sense)
066     */
067    public static synchronized CommandScheduler resetScheduler() {
068        instance = null;
069        Command.clear();
070        return getInstance();
071    }
072
073    private CommandScheduler() {
074        commandMap = new HashMap<>();
075        requirementMap = new HashMap<>();
076        defaultMap = new HashMap<>();
077        registered = new LinkedHashSet<>();
078    }
079
080    public CommandScheduler schedule(Command command) {
081        return schedule(command, () -> true);
082    }
083
084    public CommandScheduler scheduleOnce(Command command) {
085        return schedule(command);
086    }
087
088    public CommandScheduler scheduleOnceForState(Command command, CommandOpMode.OpModeState state) {
089        return scheduleForState(command, state);
090    }
091
092    public CommandScheduler scheduleInit(Command command, BooleanSupplier supplier) {
093        return scheduleForState(command, supplier, CommandOpMode.OpModeState.INIT);
094    }
095
096    public CommandScheduler scheduleInit(Command command) {
097        return scheduleForState(command, () -> true, CommandOpMode.OpModeState.INIT);
098    }
099
100    public CommandScheduler scheduleJoystick(Command command, BooleanSupplier supplier) {
101        return scheduleForState(command, supplier, CommandOpMode.OpModeState.RUN, CommandOpMode.OpModeState.END);
102    }
103
104    public CommandScheduler scheduleJoystick(Command command) {
105        return scheduleForState(command, CommandOpMode.OpModeState.RUN, CommandOpMode.OpModeState.END);
106    }
107
108    public CommandScheduler scheduleForState(
109            Command command, BooleanSupplier supplier, CommandOpMode.OpModeState... states) {
110        return schedule(
111                command.cancelUpon(() -> !opMode.getOpModeState().isState(states)),
112                () -> supplier.getAsBoolean() && opMode.getOpModeState().isState(states));
113    }
114
115    public CommandScheduler scheduleForState(Command command, CommandOpMode.OpModeState... states) {
116        return schedule(
117                command.cancelUpon(() -> !opMode.getOpModeState().isState(states)),
118                () -> opMode.getOpModeState().isState(states));
119    }
120
121    public CommandScheduler scheduleAfterOther(Command dependency, Command other) {
122        return schedule(other, dependency::justFinishedNoCancel);
123    }
124
125    public CommandScheduler scheduleWithOther(Command dependency, Command other) {
126        return schedule(other, dependency::justStarted);
127    }
128
129    public CommandScheduler scheduleAfterOther(Command dependency, Command other, BooleanSupplier additionalCondition) {
130        return schedule(other, () -> dependency.justFinishedNoCancel() && additionalCondition.getAsBoolean());
131    }
132
133    public CommandScheduler scheduleWithOther(Command dependency, Command other, BooleanSupplier additionalCondition) {
134        return schedule(other, () -> dependency.justStarted() && additionalCondition.getAsBoolean());
135    }
136
137    public CommandScheduler scheduleDefault(Command command, Subsystem subsystem) {
138        if (command.getRequirements().contains(subsystem)) {
139            defaultMap.put(subsystem, command);
140            schedule(command, () -> getCurrent(subsystem) == command);
141        } else {
142            System.err.println("default commands must require their subsystem: "
143                    + command.getClass().toString());
144        }
145        return this;
146    }
147
148    public CommandScheduler register(Periodic p) {
149        registered.add(p);
150        return this;
151    }
152
153    @Nullable
154    public Command getDefault(Subsystem s) {
155        return opMode.getOpModeState() == CommandOpMode.OpModeState.RUN ? defaultMap.get(s) : null;
156    }
157
158    @Nullable
159    public Command getCurrent(Subsystem s) {
160        if (requirementMap.get(s) == null) return null;
161        for (Command c : requirementMap.get(s)) {
162            if (c.isRunning()) return c;
163        }
164        return getDefault(s);
165    }
166
167    public CommandScheduler schedule(Command command, BooleanSupplier supplier) {
168        commandMap.put(command, supplier);
169        for (Subsystem s : command.getRequirements()) {
170            requirementMap.putIfAbsent(s, new LinkedHashSet<>());
171            requirementMap.get(s).add(command);
172            register(s);
173        }
174        return this;
175    }
176
177    public void run() {
178        // For each newly scheduled command,
179        // cancel any existing command that is using the new command's subsystem requirements
180        commandMap.forEach((c1, b) -> {
181            if (c1.justStarted()) {
182                for (Subsystem s : c1.getRequirements()) {
183                    for (Command c2 : requirementMap.get(s)) {
184                        if (c1 != c2) {
185                            c2.cancel();
186                        }
187                    }
188                }
189            }
190        });
191        commandMap.forEach((c1, b) -> {
192            if (b.getAsBoolean() || c1.isRunning()) {
193                c1.run();
194            }
195        });
196        registered.forEach(Periodic::periodic);
197    }
198}
